SENT.plain: We report a patient with the Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome accompanied by congenital hydrocephalus, which was slowly progressive and an Ommaya's reservoir was set up
However, the hydrocephalus remained stable even when the shunt was removed due to infection
Generalized tonic clonic convulsions had appeared from six months after birth and were treated with valproic acid
He died at eight months of age
Autopsy revealed extensive micropolygyria of the bilateral cerebral hemispheres and hydrocephalus
To our knowledge, it is rare for the Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome to be accompanied by congenital hydrocephalus, and there has been no previous report of its occurrence with micropolygyria
